data.title: Pittsburgh Family Lawyer, Lindsay A. (Nemit) Siters
data.meta_description: Lindsay A. (Nemit) Siters is a Pittsburgh Family Lawyer, collaborative family law attorney and certified mediator addressing complex divorce and custody cases.
data.text:
UP FOR A CHALLENGE. READY TO SERVE.

Certified mediator and collaborative law practitioner Lindsay A. (Nemit) Siters is a Pittsburgh family lawyer skilled in handling complex divorce and custody cases.

Pittsburgh family law attorney Lindsay A. (Nemit) Siters uses her experience and affinity for alternative dispute resolution options to help clients through exceptionally vulnerable times. As a certified mediator and collaborative family lawyer, she strives to meet clients’ legal requirements while respecting their privacy, resources and time.

Drawn to the practice of law by the intellectual challenge inherent in the work. Lindsay brings perseverance, unwavering commitment and an empathetic nature to her work. She builds strong, trusting relationships with clients, ultimately helping her guide them to solutions to meet their expressed needs and interests.

Lindsay was trained and certified in collaborative family law by the Collaborative Law Association of Southwestern Pennsylvania and participates in the International Academy of Collaborative Professionals.

She was trained and certified in mediation by The Conflict Lab and Behrend Mediation Services.

Prior to beginning her legal career as an associate attorney at Greg Castelli & Associates, Lindsay was a teaching and research assistant at Duquesne University School of Law and served as a judicial intern for the Honorable Patricia A. McCullough of the Commonwealth Court of Pennsylvania. During law school, Lindsay received numerous accolades and participated in the Duquesne Urban Development Practicum, providing pro bono legal services to distressed communities.

When she leaves the office, Lindsay is a busy mother — running to dance, softball, after school activities and engaging in volunteer opportunities at her daughter’s school. A born and bred Pittsburgher, you’ll often find her enjoying Pirates games, movies in the park, or whatever else the city has to offer that weekend!
